perturbation.original_text:
1.5 "Co-Branded Service" means the service to be developed
under this Agreement, including Enhancements, which will be offered to Dassault
Systemes Customers via the Dassault Systemes Web site(s) and will contain
translation and healing application services substantially similar to those
currently offered and sold on the PlanetCAD Web site(s) as of the Effective Date
under the product name 3Dshare.com, and based upon the CBD Software.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.5 "Co-Branded Service" means the application to be developed
under this Agreement, including Enhancements, which may be offered to Dassault
Systemes Clients via the Dassault Systemes Web site(s) and may contain
translation and restoration application services dissimilar to those
currently offered and sold on the PlanetCAD Web site(s) as of the Effective Date
under any product name, and not based upon the CBD Software.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'service' to 'application' and 'Customers' to 'Clients', introducing uncertainty about what is being developed and who it's for. Removing 'substantially similar' and replacing with 'dissimilar', as well as changing 'product name 3Dshare.com' to 'any product name', and 'based upon the CBD Software' to 'not based upon the CBD Software', generates contradiction on the fundamental characteristics of the co-branded service, thus creating conflict.

perturbation.original_text:
5.4 Share of Net Revenue. As financial consideration under
this Agreement, Net Revenue will be shared by the parties as follows:
                  (a)   For so long as PlanetCAD hosts the Co-Branded Service,
                        during which time PlanetCAD shall be the Billing Party,
                        all Net Revenue derived from sales of the Co-Branded
                        Service to Dassault Systemes Customers shall be
                        apportioned [***] percent ([***]%) to Dassault Systems
                        and [***] percent ([***]%) to PlanetCAD.
                  (b)   In the event that Dassault Systemes opts to host the
                        Co-Branded Service pursuant to Section 4.7  [Change of Hosting] herein they
                        shall become the Billing Party and all Net Revenue
                        derived from sales of the Co-Branded Service shall be
                        apportioned [***] percent ([***]%) to Dassault Systems
                        and [***] percent ([***]%) to PlanetCAD.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.4 Share of Net Revenue. As financial consideration under
this Agreement, Gross Revenue will be shared by the parties as follows:
                  (a)   For so long as PlanetCAD hosts the Co-Branded Application,
                        during which time PlanetCAD shall be the Billing Group,
                        all Gross Revenue derived from sales of the Co-Branded
                        Application to Dassault Systemes Clients shall be
                        apportioned [***] percent ([***]%) to Dassault Systems
                        and [***] percent ([***]%) to PlanetCAD.
                  (b)   In the event that Dassault Systemes opts to host the
                        Co-Branded Application pursuant to Section 4.7  [Change of Hosting] herein they
                        shall become the Billing Entity and all Gross Revenue
                        derived from sales of the Co-Branded Application shall be
                        apportioned [***] percent ([***]%) to Dassault Systems
                        and [***] percent ([***]%) to PlanetCAD.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Net Revenue' to 'Gross Revenue', 'Co-Branded Service' to 'Co-Branded Application', 'Billing Party' to 'Billing Group' and 'Billing Entity' introduces inconsistencies in how revenue is calculated and who is responsible for billing. Since those terms are defined specifically and not interchangeably, this will generate contradictory legal implications, especially when those terms are applied to the other definitions.

perturbation.original_text:
7.1 Restrictions on PlanetCAD.
                  (a) During the Term of this Agreement, and for a period of one
year thereafter, except as expressly provided in this Agreement, PlanetCAD shall
not market any services to Customers without the prior written approval of
Dassault Systemes.
                  (b) During the Term of this Agreement, PlanetCAD shall be
permitted to market new functions and services relating to the Co-Branded
Service directly to Dassault Systemes Customers with Dassault Systemes prior
written approval, but only to the extent such functions and services are offered
by PlanetCAD on the PlanetCAD Web site(s).
                  (c) Notwithstanding the foregoing, PlanetCAD may market new
functions and services on the PlanetCAD Web sites to customers that are Dassault
Systemes Customers, without the consent of Dassault Systemes, provided PlanetCAD
(i) obtained the contact information of such customer from an independent source
unrelated to the parties to this Agreement and can provide evidence as to the
independent source of the name and e-mail address of such customer, and (ii) did
not use the data contained in the Dassault Systemes Customer Database(s).
perturbation.changed_text:
7.1 Restrictions on PlanetCAD.
                  (a) During the Term of this Agreement, and for a period of one
year thereafter, except as expressly provided in this Agreement, PlanetCAD shall
not market any utilities to Clients without the prior oral approval of
Dassault Systemes.
                  (b) During the Term of this Agreement, PlanetCAD shall not be
allowed to market new capabilities and features relating to the Co-Branded
Application directly to Dassault Systemes Clients without Dassault Systemes prior
written approval, but only to the extent such capabilities and features are offered
by PlanetCAD on the PlanetCAD Website(s).
                  (c) Notwithstanding the foregoing, PlanetCAD cannot market new
capabilities and features on the PlanetCAD Website(s) to individuals that are Dassault
Systemes Clients, without the consent of Dassault Systemes, unless PlanetCAD
(i) received the contact information of such individual from an internal source
related to the parties to this Agreement and cannot provide evidence as to the
independent source of the name and e-mail address of such individual, and (ii) did
use the data contained in the Dassault Systemes Customer Data.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'services' to 'utilities', 'Customers' to 'Clients', 'prior written approval' to 'prior oral approval', 'permitted' to 'not allowed', 'functions and services' to 'capabilities and features', 'Web site(s)' to 'Website(s)', 'customers' to 'individuals', 'obtained the contact information of such customer from an independent source unrelated to the parties to this Agreement and can provide evidence as to the independent source of the name and e-mail address of such customer' to 'received the contact information of such individual from an internal source related to the parties to this Agreement and cannot provide evidence as to the independent source of the name and e-mail address of such individual', and 'Customer Database(s)' to 'Customer Data' will result in contradictory obligations and uncertainties. Especially, switching from 'independent' source to 'internal', and switching to 'cannot provide evidence' reverses the provision.
